meanings.definition: The condition of being untruthful; dishonesty.
meanings.sent1: Her mendacity was evident when she denied eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the mendacity in the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mendacity, his friends still trusted him with their secrets.
meanings.sent4: The web of mendacity woven by the con artist eventually unraveled.
meanings.sent5: The politician's mendacity was exposed by the leaked emails.

meanings.sent1: The child's mendacity about finishing his homework fooled no one.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't forgive him for the mendacity he used to cover up his mistake.
meanings.sent3: His mendacity about being a secret agent made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mendacity of the scammer's promises left many in financial ruin.
meanings.sent5: The mendacity of the tabloid headlines shocked the readers.
